p: Moreover, recent research regarding chemical composition or yield variation of Zingiber officinale roscoe essential oil transpired that the weight yield and chemical composition of GEO varies with cultivated geographical location of the world. Zingiber Officinale roscoe species grown in China confirmed 43 chemicals such as α-zingiberene, β-sesquiphellandrene, β-bisabolene, α-curcumene, α-bergamotene, and ar-turmerone identified as the most abundant chemicals. The GEO weight yield was 4.07% from the total sample weight ( Feng et al., 2018). Same Zingiber officinale roscoe species cultivated within a totally different area of the world such as at Ghaziabad in India revealed 80 compounds in its essential oil. The oil weight yield percentage was 1.26% from the weight of the sample. Moreover, zingiberene, citronellyl n-butyrate, valencene, β-phellandrene, selina-4(14), 7(11)-diene and β-funebrene were the most abundant compounds. All these compounds were more than 1% in relative abundance. Zingiberene content accounted for a maximum 46.7% abundance ( Sharma et al., 2016). Comparative samples from Fiji had a higher content of neral and geraniol than that of the Indian ginger. This result showed clearly that the essential oil composition varied with cultivated geographical area ( Begum et al., 2018).
